rationale: No corresponding field for 'version' in the target schema.
The field names, descriptions, and purpose of both fields are identical, representing the unique identifier for the sample.
No matching field for 'type' in the target schema.
Both fields refer to the storage duration of the source material before the sample was processed.
Both fields represent the unit of time for storage duration, with matching names and purposes.
Both fields describe the medium used during sample preparation.
Both fields describe the condition under which the sample was prepared, with matching names and descriptions.
Both fields refer to the time spent processing the tissue before preservation.
Both fields describe the unit of time for processing the sample.
Both fields describe the medium in which the sample was preserved, with identical purposes.
Both fields describe the method of sample storage after preparation, with matching names and purposes.
Both fields refer to quality assessments of the sample, with identical names and purposes.
Both fields describe histopathological reporting of key variables in the sample.
Both fields describe the thickness of the section with matching descriptions.
Both fields describe the unit of measurement for section thickness.
Both fields describe the index number of the section, with identical names and purposes.
Both fields describe the area of the tissue section, with identical names and purposes.
Both fields describe the unit of measurement for the area of the tissue section.
Both fields are used for miscellaneous notes, with matching names and purposes.
